data.title: Minecraft Farmland Hydration
data.solution:
import math
column, row = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
print(column*row - math.ceil(column/9)*math.ceil(row/9))
data.statement:
In Minecraft, crops grow on hydrated farmland. For a farmland to be hydrated, a block of water should be present up to four blocks away horizontally from the farmland block, including diagonals. In the example below, a block of water, indicated as '!', can hydrate 80 blocks of farmland as shown below:
'.' represents hydrated farmland;
'-' represents unhydrated farmland;
`------------
-.........--
-.........--
-.........--
-.........--
-....!....--
-.........--
-.........--
-.........--
-.........--
------------`
Given the number of [[column]]s and [[row]]s of the farm full of farmland blocks, you should think of the minimum number of farmland block(s) which should be replaced by water block(s) to hydrate the farm as many as possible, so that you can output the maximum number of crops that can grow in your farm (i.e. the maximum number of hydrated farmlands).
For example:
Input: 18 12
One possible solution:
`..................
..................
..................
..................
....!........!....
..................
..................
..................
..................
..................
..................
....!........!....`
The minimum amount of water blocks = 4
The maximum amount of crops = 212
Output: 212
data.stubGenerator:
read column:int row:int
write Maximum Crops
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The number of [[column]]s and [[row]]s of the farmland, separated by a space.
data.outputDescription: The maximum number of crops you can plant.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In Minecraft, crops grow on hydrated farmland. For a farmland to be hydrated, a block of water should be present up to four blocks away horizontally from the farmland block, including diagonals. In the example below, a block of water, indicated as '!', can hydrate 80 blocks of farmland as shown below:
'.' represents hydrated farmland;
'-' represents unhydrated farmland;
------------
-.........--
-.........--
-.........--
-.........--
-....!....--
-.........--
-.........--
-.........--
-.........--
------------

Given the number of columns and rows of the farm full of farmland blocks, you should think of the minimum number of farmland block(s) which should be replaced by water block(s) to hydrate the farm as many as possible, so that you can output the maximum number of crops that can grow in your farm (i.e. the maximum number of hydrated farmlands).
For example:
Input: 18 12
One possible solution:
..................
..................
..................
..................
....!........!....
..................
..................
..................
..................
..................
..................
....!........!....

The minimum amount of water blocks = 4
The maximum amount of crops = 212
Output: 212
Input
Line 1: The number of columns and rows of the farmland, separated by a space.
Output
The maximum number of crops you can plant.
Constraints
0 ≤ column ≤ 32767
0 ≤ row ≤ 32767
Example
Input
18 12
Output
212
